headline: Interesting Concept
pros: Fun atmosphere with a cutting edge concept

headline: Was good while it lasted
pros: Learned a lot at this job.  A lot of what I learned, however, was how to NOT run a business.  Plenty of talented people, just not at the very top.
cons: Most of the staff was eventually laid off.  Probably shouldn't have hired that many people so quickly in the first place, but it seemed leadership was more concerned with appearing successful than actually being successful.

headline: Interesting Learning Experience
pros: Being able to create campaigns without having to go up the food chain for approval.
cons: Lots of friends of friends of friends working. Not much if any advancement.

headline: Senior Director
pros:
-Technology combined with an emerging asset class makes for dynamic and innovative environment
-Great people that are open to new ideas to grow and improve business
-Support from NYSE and prominent VC investors
cons: -Need to be a self-starter that can build a business and take on many different roles and responsibilites

headline: Young Growing Company
pros:
- Small team with smart people who get stuff done. 
- Take on many different responsibilities in addition to defined role. 
- No red tape, if you have a good idea it gets put in motion
- Exciting growth environment
- Work hard, play hard
cons: There are no significant cons right now.

headline: Web Developer
pros: My boss was fantastic. Very hands off and not a micro-manager.
cons: The company was taken over by NYSE and soon after they began destroying the company. They fired just about every employee who helped to build the company. I was fired via email.

headline: Good idea, poor execution. This company should be a case study in strategic alignment.
pros: They are not doing much hiring right now. When they were though, there was pretty good compensation, flexible scheduling.
cons: Boring work environment, cubicle life, political. Not receptive to employee ideas.

headline: Overall my experience was quite nice.
pros: Really none now. There is no future outlook unless you are in New York.
cons: Lack of communication from management and the Board in New York.

headline: All hype.
pros: Cool bros being bros. It used to be in NOLA.
cons: They eliminated the entire New Orleans office

headline: Too Bad
pros: Great Idea and hard working employees
cons: mismanagement  at top levels and different organizational goals and views strained resources
